botanical_details.genus: Pelargonium can be perennials, sub-shrubs or shrubs, sometimes succulent and mostly evergreen, with palmately lobed or pinnately divided leaves and clusters of slightly irregular, 5-petalled flowers
botanical_details.horticultural_group: Scented-leaved pelargoniums are evergreen shrubs or perennials with strongly aromatic foliage and small, single flowers in shades of pink, purple or white

how_to_grow.cultivation: Grow in fertile, well-drained soil in full sun or partial shade. Remove spent flowers. To overwinter, grow small plants in late Summer from softwood cuttings. See pelargonium cultivation
how_to_grow.propagation: Propagate by softwood cuttings in Summer and overwinter plants in frost free conditions, or take softwood cuttings in Spring
how_to_grow.pests: May be susceptible to vine weevil, leafhoppers, caterpillars, thrips, fungus gnats, aphids and glasshouse whitefly
how_to_grow.diseases: May be susceptible to grey moulds and foot and root rots in wet conditions
